text: Ok, so i'm working on a regular expression to search out all the header information in a site.
when i run this in python reg ex.
now, in the REDemo, it works wonderfully.
When i put it in my python code, however, it only prints <a href="dog.com">
Here's my python code, I'm not sure if i'm doing something wrong or if something is lost in translation.

code:
stories=[]
  response = urllib2.urlopen('http://apricotclub.org/duh.html')
  html = response.read().lower()
  p = re.compile('<h[0-9]>\\s?(<a href=\"[A-Za-z0-9.]*\">)?\\s?[A-Za-z0-9.,:\'\"=/?;\\s]*\\s?[A-Za-z0-9.,:\'\"=/?;\\s]?')
  stories=re.findall(p, html)
  for i in stories:
    if len(i) >= 5:
      print i

text: I should also note, that when i take out the (<a href=\"[A-Za-z0-9.]*\">)?
from the regular expression it works fine for non-link <hN> lines.
